result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel S. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Payment of $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $579.00 due at $100 per month beginning 01-01-2023 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant Daniel S. Erickson in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Daniel S. Erickson.  Attorney Mitchell John Philbin in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CM40 and 22CM12.
Atty Spansail provides plea form.
ADA heard on agreement.
Atty Spansail agrees.
Victim rights compliance.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2 of 22CM12.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 1 of 22CM40 without the Repeater enhancer.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court informs of possible firearm restrictions due to the domestic violence charge.
Deft understands.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Elements of offense.
Atty Spansail satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 2 of 22CM12.
Court dismisses and reads-in Count 1 of 22CM12.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 1 of 22CM40 without the Repeater enhancer.
Court dismisses the repeater enhancer from Count 1 of 22CM40.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 2 and 3 of 22CM40.
ADA heard on sentencing.
Atty Spansail heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposes on Count 2 of 22CM12: 
30 days jail with good time and huber release.
Deft to report to the Marinette County Jail no later than 7pm on October 25, 2022. 
Payment of $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $579.00 - $500 bond on deposit to be applied to fees due with remaining balance due at $100 per month beginning 01-01-2023 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
Court imposes on Count 1 of 22CM40:
90 days jail with good time and huber release, concurrent to the jail sentence in 22CM12.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + DNA surcharge = $579.00 due at $100 per month beginning 01-01-2023 or civil judgment and referral to State Debt Collections.
DNA sample due 10-25-2022.
9:12 AM

10:31 AM Defendant Daniel S. Erickson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Daniel S. Erickson.  Attorney Mraz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22cm40 and 22CM12.
Atty Spansail heard - deft has rejected the offer.
Requests matter be set for trial.
Parties discuss - trial will be set for 22CM40 and that is charged as a repeater.
10:33 off record.
10:35 back on record.
Court schedules with parties.
Motions, proposed jury instructions and verdicts to be submitted by 09-09-22.
Evidentiary motions to be submitted by July 15, 2022.
10:37 AM
Jury trial scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
